title: The Missing Project

curriculum.subject: Social-Emotional Learning
learningObjectives: Students will practice offering help when peers face setbacks
Students will demonstrate empathy in difficult situations
Students will choose helpful responses over passive observation

selObjectives: Recognize when peers need support during setbacks
Practice offering help without being asked
Balance personal goals with supporting others

caselCoverage.self-awareness: Noticing your own reactions to others' problems
caselCoverage.self-management: Balancing your own tasks with helping others
caselCoverage.social-awareness: Recognizing distress and need in peers
caselCoverage.relationship-skills: Offering help and working together during setbacks
caselCoverage.responsible-decision-making: Choosing to help when it might affect your own work

intro.text: You arrive at school early on science fair day.
You're excited to set up your volcano project in the gym.
The hallways echo with your footsteps.
You push through the gymnasium's double doors.
Scattered around it are pieces of what looks like a broken model.
Across the gym, Kai is frantically searching through a box.
Maya stands nearby, holding a crumpled piece of paper.
Mr. Rodriguez is setting up chairs at the far end of the room.

beats.text: You set your volcano materials on your table.
You look more closely at the scattered pieces.
Some appear to be painted planets.
There's a bent wire that might have held them in orbit.
Kai looks up from his box and catches your eye.
He glances toward Maya with a worried expression.
Maya is reading the crumpled paper more carefully.

choices.text: Walk over to Kai and ask what happened to the solar system project
Gather the scattered planet pieces and place them on the empty table
choices.illustrationHint: You carefully picking up planet pieces

choices.text: Continue setting up your volcano while keeping an eye on them
choices.illustrationHint: You setting up your volcano, looking over

beats.text: It's covered with drawings and measurements.
She walks over to the scattered pieces and kneels down.
She compares something on the paper to the broken pieces.
"I thought I put everything away safely last night," Maya says quietly.
Her voice sounds sad and confused.

choices.text: Ask Maya if she needs help fixing her project
choices.illustrationHint: You kneeling beside Maya, offering help

choices.text: Look around the gym for any other clues about what might have happened

beats.text: You notice a small trail of glitter on the floor.
It leads from Maya's table toward the storage closet.
The closet door is slightly open.
Kai has returned and is now helping Maya sort through the pieces.
Other students are starting to arrive with their projects.
The room fills with sounds of setup and conversation.

choices.text: Follow the glitter trail to the storage closet and investigate
Approach Mr. Rodriguez and mention what you observed
Focus on perfecting your own volcano setup while staying nearby

ending.text: The gym fills with students and parents as the science fair begins.
Maya has created a new display using her drawings and salvageable pieces.
Kai helps her explain the solar system to visitors.
Your volcano demonstration draws a small crowd.
Mr. Rodriguez makes notes on his clipboard as he moves between projects.
The morning unfolds with presentations, questions, and excited discovery.
